Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Per the by-laws the sole voting member of the Brent Eley Center Inc. is the Brent Eley Foundation the supported Colorado nonprofit corporation. The Brent Eley Foundation operates Brent's Place property used to provide housing and support services near medical facilities for families with a child or adult undergoing treatment for cancer and other life-threatening diseases. Brent Eley Center Inc. owned the Brent's Place facilities and associated debt. At the December 16th 2021 Board meeting as its sole voting member the Brent Eley Foundation Board voted to dissolve Brent Eley Center Inc. Further upon dissolution all Brent Eley Center Inc.'s assets remaining after payment of or provision for all of its liabilities would be distributed to the Brent Eley Foundation as set forth in section 501c3 of the Internal Revenue Code. As well the Board members of Brent Eley Center Inc. were added to the Brent Eley Foundation Board for the remainder of their terms. Brent Eley Center Inc. was dissolved as a legal Colorado entity on August 30 2022. At that time all remaining assets had a book value of $15524612 and outstanding debt totaled $166788. Total Net Assets of $15357824 were contributed by Brent Eley Center Inc. to the Brent Eley Foundation as of August 31 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Per the by laws, the sole voting member of the Brent Eley Center, Inc. is the Brent Eley Foundation,the supported Colorado nonprofit corporation.The Brent Eley Foundation operates Brents Place, property used to provide housing and support services near medical facilities for families with a child or adult undergoing treatment for cancer and other lifethreatening diseases. Brent Eley Center, Inc. owned the Brents Place facilities and associated debt. At the December 16th 2021 Board meeting as its sole voting member the Brent Eley Foundation Board voted to dissolve Brent Eley Center Inc. Further upon dissolution,all Brent Eley Center Incs assets remaining after payment of or provision for all of its liabilities would be distributed to the Brent Eley Foundation,as set forth in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. As well the Board members of Brent Eley Center Inc. were added to the Brent Eley Foundation Board for the remainder of their terms. Brent Eley Center Inc. wasdissolved as a legal Colorado entity on August 30 2022. A certified copy of the Articles of Dissolution filed with the Colorado Secretary of State, along with the Board of Directors resolution, are attached to this Schedule. At that time all remaining assets had a book value of $15524612 and outstanding debt totaled $166788.Total Net Assets of $15357824 were contributed by Brent Eley Center Inc.to the Brent Eley Foundation as of August 31 2022. Board of Directors Dissolution Resolutionunable to upload a PDF of this document with the return Brent Eley Foundation (BEF) Brent Eley Center (BEC) Board of Directors Combined Meeting Minutes December 16th,2021 Live Zoom call Attendance: BEC/BEF Board Members present: Dominic Dezzutti, Terry Staples, DeAnn Noyes, Caryn Ellison, John Connor, Dee Strong, Darren Lemkau, Josh Simon, Lori Bell, Mark Petty, Erwin Gelfand, MD, Roger Giller, MD, Bruce Siegrist, Donn and Linda Eley, Andi Freyer, Tom Smith MD, Suzy Jaeger, Patrick Gaines and Gina Tincher Quorum Present: A quorum was present for both boards at the beginning of the meeting Brent Eley Center DiscussionDonn Eley talked about dissolving the Brent Eley Center, and that this was the perfect time to talk about it because of the lack of debt.There is no reason to not dissolve it at this point.The reason it was formed in the first place dealt with the existence of real estate on our books being a problem with donors and that has not materialized as a problem.A resolution to dissolve the Brent Eley Center was presented by John Connor. Questions were answered during a discussion of the issue.The Brent Eley Foundation was formed March 13, 1997. The Brent Eley Center was formed in 2006. The Brent Eley Center was formed as a Supporting Organization under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Service for the purpose of controlling the real estate assets required to provide the Place for those living with cancer to stay immediately after their discharge from local hospitals. The real estate owned by the Brent Eley Center can only be used by the Brent Eley Foundation. As its sole voting member, the Brent Eley Foundation votes to dissolve the Brent Eley Center. Upon dissolution, all of the Brent Eley Centers assets remaining after payment of or provision for all of its liabilities will be distributed to the Brent Eley Foundation, as set forth in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. WHEREFORE, the Brent Eley Center and the Brent Eley Foundation hereby desire to dissolve the Brent Eley Center and transfer all assets of the Brent Eley Center to the Brent Eley Foundation. John Connor offered a motion to approve the resolution, with Donn Eley seconding. The motion passed without dissent. Governance CommitteeDue to the dissolution of the Brent Eley Center, it was proposed that the board members of the Brent Eley Center should be added to the Brent Eley Foundation Board for the remainder of their terms. That slate included Bruce Siegrist, Erwin Gelfand, MD and Terry Staples. Lori moved and Donn seconded.The motion passed without dissent. | Explanation:| Per the by-laws the sole voting member of the Brent Eley Center Inc. is the Brent Eley Foundation the supported Colorado nonprofit corporation. The Brent Eley Foundation operates Brent's Place property used to provide housing and support services near medical facilities for families with a child or adult undergoing treatment for cancer and other life-threatening diseases. Brent Eley Center Inc. owned the Brent's Place facilities and associated debt. At the December 16th 2021 Board meeting as its sole voting member the Brent Eley Foundation Board voted to dissolve Brent Eley Center Inc. Further upon dissolution all Brent Eley Center Inc.'s assets remaining after payment of or provision for all of its liabilities would be distributed to the Brent Eley Foundation as set forth in section 501c3 of the Internal Revenue Code. As well the Board members of Brent Eley Center Inc. were added to the Brent Eley Foundation Board for the remainder of their terms. Brent Eley Center Inc. was dissolved as a legal Colorado entity on August 30 2022. A certified copy of the Articles of Dissolution filed with the Colorado Secretary of State along with the Board of Directors' resolution is included in Schedule N. At that time all remaining assets had a book value of $15524612 and outstanding debt totaled $166788. Total Net Assets of $15357824 were contributed by Brent Eley Center Inc. to the Brent Eley Foundation as of August 31 2022.|
